metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2753 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FreeXL before 1.0.0i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted sector in a workbook.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0g-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
